title: Mastery-Based Blended Education Program for Laparoscopic Surgery Training

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational medical knowledge and understanding of surgical procedures
context.additional_context: Laparoscopic surgery training program for pre-service/in-service teachers, operated by corporate medical education institutions in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can perform laparoscopic basic skills (hand-eye coordination, bimanual manipulation, suturing, and knot-tying) to mastery standards within four weeks.
Learners can analyze and evaluate performance metrics (time, accuracy, etc.) during simulation training to apply self-directed feedback.
Learners can complete the FLS (Fundamentals of Laparoscopic Surgery) standard practice tasks with a pass rate of 80% or higher.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
